info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:41AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila, Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 430 AM MST... At 341 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Superior, moving west at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Tempe, Apache Junction, Florence, Globe, Superior, Hayden, East Mesa, Christmas, Gold Canyon, Queen Creek, San Carlos, Miami, Gold Camp, Usery Mountain Park, San Tan Valley, Seville and Florence Junction. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 between mile markers 179 and 259. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 162 and 171. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 22 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
